channel.title: C# on Garbage Collected
channel.description: Recent content in C# on Garbage Collected

item.title: Never Force Yourself to Learn New Skills Without a Concrete Project
item.description: As the job demand is going nowhere in a decade, a lot of new guys want to get into programming. There are numerous courses online, teaching a variety of skills in programming. There are also new shinning frameworks climbing up GitHub trending every day. I see a lot of people, typically newly graduated students, get confused. There seems to be an endless stream of knowledge to learn. How much skill is enough?
